result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin R. LECLAIR was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery - PTAC [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin R. LECLAIR

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: All records scanned and verified.

Defendant in custody.
NO CONTEST plea entered to count 1, PTC battery.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2, 3 and 4.  Motion granted.
The defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for sixty (60) days, under the Huber Law, commencing on 01-13-2017.
$443.00 court costs imposed.  $500.00 cash bail applied.  $57.00 balance transferred to 16 CF 54 and applied.
Defendant has credit for 18 days.
Minutes.
Plea date on November 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Plea date on December 6, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on bench warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The matter is continued for plea date on 11-29-16 at 3:30 p.m.   Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the condition that defendant must report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release.   Bail not furnished.   Defendant remanded to the county jail.   Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.   Copy filed.     
Minutes.
Warrant served.

Defendant failed to appear for a plea date.
State requests warrant and forfeiture of bail.  Court authorizes warrant and forfeiture of bail.
Minutes.
Plea date reset to 10-10-16 at 11:00 a.m.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of battery as party to the crime, disorderly conduct, carry or display facsimile firearm and misdemeanor bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 12-21-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and defendant is to have no contact with Danielle Koch.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
